simrun2.crossing_over package¶

Submodules¶

simrun2.crossing_over.crossing_over_simple_interface module¶

simrun2.crossing_over.crossing_over_simple_interface.crossing_over(mdb, sim_trails, time, cellParamName, evokedUpParamName, dirPrefix='', nSweeps=1000, tStop=345, silent=True, scale_apical=<function scale_apical>)[source]¶
simrun2.crossing_over.crossing_over_simple_interface.crossing_over_helper(pdf, time, cellParamName, evokedUpParamName, dirPrefix='', nSweeps=1000, tStop=345, silent=True, scale_apical=<function scale_apical>)[source]¶
simrun2.crossing_over.crossing_over_simple_interface.scale_apical(cell)[source]¶

scale apical diameters depending on distance to soma; therefore only possible after creating complete cell

simrun2.crossing_over.run_skip_time module¶

simrun2.crossing_over.run_skip_time.skip_time(df, t_skip_start, t_skip_end)[source]¶

accepts a synapse activation pandas data frame. Returns a dataframe, where synapse activation in the specified interval is skipped.

simrun2.crossing_over.run_skip_time.skip_time_and_save(df_db, sim_trail_index, t_skip_start, t_skip_end, dirPrefix)[source]¶
simrun2.crossing_over.run_skip_time.skip_time_and_save_parallel(synapse_activation_db, sim_trail_index_list, t_skip_start, t_skip_end, dirPrefix)[source]¶

returns delayed object which on computation generates synapse activation files with skipped time interval

simrun2.crossing_over.utils module¶

simrun2.crossing_over.utils.filter_by_time(pdf, filterfun)[source]¶

takes a standard synapse activation file returns a new dataframe of the same format containing only the activations, for which filterfun returns True

filterfun: function that gets called with every timepoint a synapse gets activated. If it returns True, the activation will be kept, if it returns False, it will be omitted.

simrun2.crossing_over.utils.generate_output_path(tuple_, prefix='')[source]¶
simrun2.crossing_over.utils.merge_synapse_activation(pdf1, pdf2)[source]¶

merges two synapse activation data tables
